item.title: Tutorial 0 â€“ Introduction
item.description: Welcome to this basic tutorial series about PraxisLIVE. In this first episode, you’ll be introduced to the software and what are its possibles usages. PraxisLIVE is an open source software for artists to create advanced multimedia content (for example video mappings, audio-syncronized visuals created with code, or GUIs to manage MIDI sounds). Here’s a list of its key features: intuitive graphical patching, so it works with nodes written in Processing, a Java-based scripting language; You can modify the project and nodes values while running it; Real-time audio/video (it uses infact OpenGL, GStreamer, JACK); It can manage MIDI, OSC, GUIs and physical computing, which are computers that are able to translate real world signals, like sounds or movements, as an input; It’s cross-platform (Windows, MacOS, Linux and even Raspberry Pi!
